PHILIPS Smart Air Purifier User Manual
Dashboard displays overview of both indoor and outdoor AQI
Left of canvas contains links to different sections of the app.
Right of canvas contains controls for your Philips Smart Air Purifier.
You will see the status of your Philips Smart Air Purifier on the dashboard.
The indoor detail page shows the air level readings and history from your Philips Smart Air Purifier.
Outdoor detail page shows the air quality readings, history and weather from your chosen locations.
Tap once to enlarge each category, tap second time to view details.
Tap to open and close the canvas.
Tap to open and close the canvas.
Tap the arrow to go back to the dashboard.
Take a tour of the app
If you want to take the tour of the app in the future you can find it under \'Help and Documentation\' in your left hand navigation.
Select the purifier you want to register.
Is the purifier you want to register not listed here?
Philips can email you promotions and offers.

Detailed air quality for the last 4 weeks?
Indoor air quality level and PM2.5
Correlation between indoor and outdoor air quality, and how they are measured
How much good air did you have? explained
In the last 7 days, amount of indoor air rated as
by air purifiers, and outdoor air rated as

If 1–2 for one hour or longer, then the PM2.5 level is expected to be lower than the Chinese AQI standard of outdoor air of 75 micrograms per cubic metre. If level above 2 for one hour or longer, then PM2.5 is expected to be higher than the Chinese AQI standard of outdoor air of 75 micrograms per cubic metre.

There is no standard for PM2.5 indoor, therefore there is no indoor PM2.5 level shown. Philips measures both indoor and outdoor PM2.5 levels. However, there is a correlation between outdoor and indoor air quality, the higher the level of PM2.5 indoors is strongly correlated to the PM2.5 level outdoors.

Very Unhealthy. Very high Particle level. PM2.5 values are expected to be at high level. Peaks can be due to cigarrete smoke, cooking, vacuum-cleaning, candles and incense. You should avoid to be in a areas with this particle level of air for longer period of time. Adults and children with lung problems, adults with heart problems, and older people, should avoid strenuous physical activity. People with asthma may find they need to use their reliever inhaler more often.

Unhealthy air. High Particle level. PM2.5 values are expected to be at higher level as well. You should avoid to be in a areas with this particle level of air for longer period of time. Slight irritations may occur. Adults and children with lung problems, and adults with heart problems, should reduce strenuous physical exertion, and particularly if they experience symptoms. People with asthma may find they need to use their reliever inhaler more often. Older people should also reduce physical exertion.

Moderate Air. Moderate particle level in the air. PM2.5 level is also expected to be moderate. Adults and children with lung problems, and adults with heart problems, who experience symptoms, should consider reducing strenuous physical activity.
Good Air. Overall there is low dust and particle levels in the air. The PM2.5 level is expected to be low. Health risk is considered to be minor. Enjoy your usual indoor activities.

Hazardous. Healthy people will experience reduced endurance in activities. There may be strong irritations and air quality may trigger other illnesses. The elderly and sick should remain indoors and avoid exercise. Healthy individuals should avoid outdoor activities.

Unhealthy. Healthy people will be noticeably affected. People with breathing or heart problems will experience reduced endurance in activities. These individuals and the elderly should remain indoors and restrict activities.
Moderately polluted. Slight irritations may occur, individuals with breathing or heart problems should reduce outdoor exercise.
Slightly polluted. Irritations may occur, individuals with breathing or heart problems should reduce outdoor exercise.
Healthy. Hypersensitive individuals should reduce outdoor exercise.
You can set times to receive notifications about the air quality in your home, and the AQI in your saved outdoor locations.
You will receive notifications for all of the purifiers you are connected to.
You will receive notifications when the air quality in your saved outdoor locations rises above the level set by you.
You will receive notifications when the air quality in your home rises above the level set by you.
You will receive this notification when any of the purifiers you are connected to detect air quality above the level set by you.
You will receive a notification when a filter needs replacing.
You will receive this notification for all of the purifiers you are connected to.

Nobody can avoid the increasingly alarming air quality issues as we live in an urban setting. To purify indoor air in a natural and holistic way, count on the Philips VitaShield Intelligent Purification System.
Removes ultra-fine particles of down to 20 nanometres.
Natural filtration ensures the family\'s well-being.
Adapts to different home environment and various needs.
World Health Organization (WHO) studies show that indoor air is often 10–30 times more polluted than outdoor air. Our homes are threatened by many air pollutants.
A colourless gas released from paints, solvents and adhesives found in furniture and wood products. It is irritant and a known carcinogen, forming serious health risk with prolonged exposure.
TVOCs are harmful gas emitting from cleaning agents, disinfectants and paints. They include toluene, benzene, xylene, higher alkenes and aldehydes.
Bacteria, fungi (moulds) and viruses are all present in indoor air. Bacteria cause coughs, colds and more serious illnesses like tuberculosis.
Pet hair and dust mites gather on the floor and carpet. Pet hair may cause allergies of the eyes and airways while dust mites often trigger allergies and asthma.
Yellow dust, fine dust and pollen can cause allergies and various respiratory diseases. One of the biggest problems with indoor air quality is outdoor air.

Particles smaller than 2.5 micrometres (PM 2.5) can penetrate and settle in the deepest parts of the lungs and cause cardiac disease and other cardiovascular health problems. They stay a long time in the atmosphere, travel long distances and pose serious health risks.

At the core of Philips VitaShield IPS technology is a leading multi-faceted active filtration system. With layers of meticulously designed filters, the system guards your health against almost all indoor air pollutants.
Four-tiered filtration for 4 times the protection
Particles with a diameter wider than 1 micrometre are blocked by the filter.
Particles with a diameter wider than 0.5 micron stick to the filter during their airborne inertial motion.
Particles floating in the air current with a diameter between 0.1 and 0.5 micrometres are attracted to the filter by electrostatic forces.
Randomly absorbs fine particles that move erratically in the air. Removes harmful particulates less than 2.5 micrometres in diameter (PM 2.5).

An advanced aerodynamic wind tunnel design and a hushed engine suck air in rapidly, even from far room corners. As air circulation is promoted, the purification process improves significantly.\nOptimised design improves airflow through the filters and the purifier can run at a lower speed to reduce noise.

Dust, pollen, pet dander, PM 2.5, mould spores and other airborne particles at home cause coughing, sneezing, red eyes, itchy nose, asthma, eczema and other allergic symptoms.\n\nThe Philips VitaShield IPS is certified by the European Centre for Allergy Research Foundation (ECARF) for its efficacy in easing allergies and creating a safe environment for those with allergies.
The Philips VitaShield IPS\'s multi-level active filtration blocks up to 99.7% of airborne particles, preventing irritants from triggering allergic reactions.
Intelligent sensors are constantly monitoring to ensure all-day protection.
Zero ozone emissions prevents further pollution and infection.

\'New home syndrome\' is spreading with urbanisation. Harmful and toxic gases such as formaldehyde and toluene are released into the air from synthetic construction and decorating materials. These pollutants can persist for four years after work has finished.\n\nUp to 50% of homes in China exceed the country\'s standard for formaldehyde content in air and up to 40% exceed the standard for TVOC.
The Philips VitaShield IPS\'s New Home filter offers triple protection against \'new home syndrome\':

1. Active carbon coating traps formaldehyde on the outside surface.

2. Each gram of active carbon has a surface area of around 1000m2. Many pollutants are filtered by this enormous surface area.

3. Nano-pores are precisely positioned to block and collect hazardous gases.

Test conducted in a 30M³ room reveal that almost all formaldehyde is removed after using the New Home filter for three hours.

Increasing population density, globalisation and drug resistance lead to high incidence of airborne disease. From workplaces to public areas, we are getting more vulnerable to epidemic disease.

The Philips VitaShield IPS traps pollutants down to a microscopic level of just 20 nanometres, removing bird flu and influenza virus, legionnella and other common pathogens.

Test results indicate a reduction of 99.9% of bacteria and viruses within one hour of using the Philips VitaShield IPS

Check air quality and PM2.5 levels in major cities. Source: US Embassy Beijing Air Quality Monitoring Program (United States Embassy in China Monitoring Center: beijing.usembassy-china.org.cn) and Beijing Environmental Protection Monitoring Center (Beijing Environmental Protection Monitoring Center: www.bjmemc.com.cn).

Hazardous. Healthy people will experience reduced endurance in activities. There may be significant irritation and air quality may trigger other illnesses. The elderly and sick should remain indoors and avoid exercise. Healthy individuals should avoid outdoor activities.

Very unhealthy. Healthy people will be noticeably affected. People with breathing or heart problems will experience reduced endurance in activities. These individuals and the elderly should remain indoors and restrict activities.
Unhealthy. Some slight irritation may occur. Individuals with breathing or heart problems should reduce outdoor exercise.
Unhealthy for sensitive groups. Some irritation may occur. Individuals with breathing or heart problems should reduce outdoor exercise.
Moderate. Hyper-sensitive individuals should reduce outdoor exercise.

Very unhealthy air. Very high particle levels. PM2.5 values are expected to be at high levels. Peaks can be due to cigarrete smoke, cooking, vacuum-cleaning, candles and incense. You should avoid to be in a areas with this particle level of air for longer period of time. Adults and children with lung problems, adults with heart problems, and older people, should avoid strenuous physical activity. People with asthma may find they need to use their reliever inhaler more often.

Unhealthy air. High particle levels. PM2.5 values are expected to be at higher levels too. You should avoid being in areas with these particle levels for extended periods. Some irritation may occur. Adults and children with lung problems, and adults with heart problems, should reduce strenuous physical exertion, and particularly if they experience symptoms. People with asthma may find they need to use their inhalers more often. Older people should also reduce physical exertion.

Moderate air. Moderate particle levels in the air. The PM2.5 level is also expected to be moderate. Adults and children with lung problems, and adults with heart problems who experience symptoms should consider reducing strenuous physical activity.
Good air. Overall there is low dust and particle levels in the air. The PM2.5 level is expected to be low. Health risk is considered to be minor. Enjoy your usual indoor activities.

The Philips Smart Air app shows real-time air particle level on a scale of 1–10 measured by a smart built-in sensor. You can read update air quality information in your home, including PM2.5 concentration.
Follow these 3 easy steps to connect your Philips Smart Air Purifier to your home Wi-Fi and pair with your phone.
For a successful Wi-Fi connection, position the Philips Smart Air Purifier within reach of your router. Obstacles such as walls may affect the Wi-Fi performance.
Confirm Wi-Fi on your Philips Smart Air Purifier.
Connect your Philips Smart Air Purifier to your home Wi-Fi network.
Plug in the Philips Smart Air Purifier and press \"Power\" and \"Childlock\" buttons simultaneously, until the Wi-Fi LED
